intro: Relhania styphelioides, commonly known as the golden mistletoe, is a hemiparasitic plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Viscaraceae and is characterized by its small, leathery leaves and clusters of yellowish-white flowers. The plant relies on host trees for water and nutrients, while it provides nectar to attract pollinators such as bees and birds. Its seeds are dispersed by birds that consume its fleshy berries. Relhania styphelioides plays a role in local ecosystems by supporting biodiversity and contributing to the ecological balance of its habitat.
